description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted through infected female Anopheles mosquito bites.
risk_factors: Living in or traveling to tropical regions

treatment.lifestyle_changes: Use of insect repellent, mosquito nets
treatment.prevention: Mosquito nets, insect repellent, antimalarial drugs

description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a contagious infection caused by bacteria, primarily affecting the lungs.

treatment.medications: Combination of antibiotics (isoniazid, rifampin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide) for 6-9 months
treatment.lifestyle_changes: Good nutrition, avoid close contact with TB patients
treatment.prevention: BCG vaccination, screening, treating latent TB

description: The common cold is a viral infection of the nose and throat (upper respiratory tract).

treatment.medications: Over-the-counter pain relievers, decongestants, cough suppressants
treatment.supportive_care: Rest, hydration, gargling with salt water
treatment.prevention: Frequent handwashing, avoiding close contact with sick individuals

symptoms: Severe coughing fits followed by a 'whooping' sound
description: Whooping cough (pertussis) is a highly contagious respiratory tract infection caused by bacteria.

treatment.supportive_care: Rest, hydration, monitoring for breathing difficulties
treatment.lifestyle_changes: Avoid exposure to infected individuals, especially unvaccinated children

description: Cholera is an acute diarrheal infection caused by ingestion of food or water contaminated with the bacterium Vibrio cholerae.

treatment.medications: Oral rehydration salts (ORS), antibiotics (in severe cases)
treatment.lifestyle_changes: Drink only clean water, proper sanitation practices
treatment.prevention: Safe water and sanitation, cholera vaccination

treatment.lifestyle_changes: Boost immune system through proper diet and exercise

description: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) weakens the immune system, making it difficult to fight off infections, leading to AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome).

treatment.prevention: Use of condoms, Pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP), safe needle practices

symptoms: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that affects the liver, potentially leading to chronic liver disease or liver cancer.

treatment.supportive_care: Regular liver function monitoring, maintaining healthy diet
treatment.lifestyle_changes: Avoid alcohol, healthy diet, safe sexual practices
treatment.prevention: Hepatitis B vaccine, safe needle use
